description: A vRtrMldIfRxQueryVerMismatch notification is generated when the
MLD interface is configured as MLDv2 but the router receives a
MLDv1 Query on the interface.
vRtrIfIndex will identify the router interface on which the query is
received. vRtrMldIfAdminVersion will contain the configured
version of the interface and vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion
will contain the version of the received query.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfRxQueryVerMismatch TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfAdminVersion i 1 TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion u 9999

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The value of vRtrMldIfAdminVersion specifies the configured version
of the MLD which is running on this interface.
This object can be used to configure a router capable of
running either value. For the MLD to function correctly, all
routers on a LAN must be configured to run the same version
of the MLD on that LAN.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfAdminVersion

description: vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrMldIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion

description: A vRtrMldIfCModeRxQueryMismatch notification is generated
when there is a mismatch between the compatible mode of the interface
and the version of the received query.
It is generated when the MLD interface is in MLDv1 compatible mode
but it receives a MLDv2 Query on the interface.
vRtrIfIndex will identify the router interface on which the query is
received. vRtrMldIfOperVersion will indicate the compatibility mode
of the interface and vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion will contain the
version of the received query.

event.Summary: Mismatch detected between the compatible mode of the interface and the version ($v4) of the received query

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfCModeRxQueryMismatch TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfOperVersion i 1 TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion u 9999

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The value of vRtrMldIfOperVersion indicates the operational version
of the MLD which is running on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfOperVersion

description: vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrMldIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldNotifyQueryVersion

description: The vRtrMldMaxGrpsLimitExceeded event is generated when an
attempt is made to configure a group when vRtrMldIfGroupCount,
the number of groups configured on the PIM interface, is equal
to vRtrMldIfMaxGroups, the maximum number of groups supported
on the system.

event.Summary: Number of groups configured on the PIM interface is exceeded the threshold ($v1)

description: The value of vRtrMldIfMaxGroups specifies the maximum number of groups
for which the MLD can have local receiver information based on received
MLD reports on this interface. When this configuration is changed
dynamically to a value lower than currently accepted number of groups
the groups that are already accepted are not deleted. Only new groups
will not be allowed. When this object has a value of 0, there is no
limit to the number of groups.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MLD-MIB::vRtrMldIfMaxGroups
